title: [compute] [nla] Node Lifecycle Automation
description:

## Logs query
[my pod](https://app.datadoghq.com/logs?query=%40objectRef.resource%3A%28events%20OR%20pods%29%20%28%40requestObject.involvedObject.name%3ApodName%20OR%20%40objectRef.name%3ApodName%29%20-%40http.method%3Aget%20-%40objectRef.subresource%3Aeviction&cols=kubernetes_cluster%2C%40requestObject.metadata.namespace%2C%40requestObject.source.component%2C%40http.method%2C%40objectRef.name%2C%40requestObject.reason%2C%40requestObject.message&index=k8s-audit&messageDisplay=inline&stream_sort=time%2Casc&live=true) : replace {podName} by the real value in the logs query.

@david.benque

definition.content:
[Documentation](https://datadoghq.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/K8S/pages/2274623742/NLA+-+Node+Lifecycle+Automation) | [FAQ](https://datadoghq.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/K8S/pages/2277966820/NLA+-+FAQ) |
[Dashboard list](https://app.datadoghq.com/dashboard/lists?q=%5Bcompute%5D+%5Bnla%5D) | [Slack](https://dd.slack.com/archives/C010UB763NE)

Audit logs for **[my pod](../../logs?query=%40objectRef.resource%3A%28events%20OR%20pods%29%20%28%40requestObject.involvedObject.name%3ApodName%20OR%20%40objectRef.name%3ApodName%29%20%40requestObject.source.component%3Adraino&cols=kubernetes_cluster%2C%40requestObject.metadata.namespace%2C%40requestObject.source.component%2C%40http.method%2C%40objectRef.name%2C%40requestObject.reason%2C%40requestObject.message&index=k8s-audit&messageDisplay=inline&stream_sort=time%2Casc&live=true)** , **[my node](https://app.datadoghq.com/logs?query=%40objectRef.resource%3A%28events%20OR%20nodes%29%20%28%40requestObject.involvedObject.name%3AnodeName%20OR%20%40objectRef.name%3AnodeName%29%20-%40http.method%3A%28get%20OR%20watch%29%20%40requestObject.source.component%3Adraino&cols=kubernetes_cluster%2C%40requestObject.source.component%2C%40http.method%2C%40objectRef.name%2C%40requestObject.spec.unschedulable%2C%40requestObject.reason%2C%40requestObject.message&index=k8s-audit&messageDisplay=inline&stream_sort=time%2Casc&live=true)** and [evictions](https://app.datadoghq.com/logs?query=%40usr.name%3A%22system%3Aserviceaccount%3Acluster-controllers%3Adraino%22%20%20%40requestObject.reason%3A%28Evictio%2A%20OR%20Cordo%2A%20OR%20Uncord%2A%20OR%20Drain%2A%29&agg_m=count&agg_q=%40requestObject.involvedObject.name&agg_t=count&cols=kubernetes_cluster%2C%40requestObject.involvedObject.kind%2C%40objectRef.name%2C%40requestObject.reason%2C%40requestObject.message%2C%40requestObject.involvedObject.name&index=k8s-audit&messageDisplay=inline&sort_m=&sort_t=&stream_sort=time%2Cdesc&top_n=10&top_o=top&viz=stream&from_ts=1637942472685&to_ts=1637946072685&live=true)

replace {podName|nodeName} by the real value in the logs query + set time window

---

[Detailed node investigation](https://app.datadoghq.com/dashboard/6ah-rai-6w3/nla-node-investigation?from_ts=1680436847473&to_ts=1680609647473&live=true)
where you can find more information about why a node is not being drained.

definition.title: Nodes in scope of NLA [ For all users ]

definition.content:
This group is to reveal the number of nodes in scope **overall**.

If you are interested by only a specific `condition`, select a value in the *conditions* filter and go to the dedicated group under this one.

definition.title: Top 100 NG in volume (use sort to switch category)
Nodes out of scope per NG
Nodes out of scope per NG (Kafka out)
Conditions and Draining [ For all users ]
Node count evolution per condition over 1 hour

definition.content: If a node is drain and have 2 conditions, it is reported 2 times in the following tables.

definition.title: % nodes in scope remaining for each condition (top right corner is bad)

definition.content:
This plot will reveal number of nodes in scope for a given conditions that should be processed.

The top right corner quadrant is clearly a bad spot, it means that we have a lot of nodes that are in scope but not processed

definition.title: Node count evolution per condition over 1 day
Node count evolution per condition over 1 week

definition.content:
Green means that the we have less nodes with that condition.

More node with the signal have been replaced that added.


Red means that more nodes have the condition than before. That does not mean that the drain is not working; it could be working but more nodes with the signal have appeared in the meantime.

definition.title: Node waiting to be processed per cluster (in-scope node only) - includes all drain state (sheduled, completed, failed)
Node count evolution per condition over 1 month

definition.content: Drain Status for node actually handled by draino

definition.title: Node being process by drain - distribution in status (Scheduled|Completed|Failed)

definition.content: !!! This group is to relevant only if the filter `condition` is set to a specific value !!!

This group give some more details per conditions compare to first group

Text Filter in table applies only on the Top elements --> use the template at the top of the page for a correct filtering

definition.title: Top 50  conditions for a given cluster: in-scope
Top 50  conditions for a given cluster: out-scope
InScope ratio % per cluster (0% do not appear)
Top 100 NG with condition(s) (use sort to switch category)
Node out of scope per NG

definition.content:
Clusters and NG that stay at their cordon limit for a long period reflects the fact that NLA cannot progress on that cluster or nodegroup.

It worth checking if we are not in one of the following case:
- many node block with drain failed
- cluster-autoscaler can't scale-down empty nodes
- - MinSize>1 on the NG
- - CA in cool-down or scaleup loop or not working
- users have manually cordon many nodes
- too many notReady nodes
- too many pending pods

definition.title: Global block at Cluster level: Too much NotReadyNodes or too much Pending pods

markers.label: any cluster appearing here is blocked for any Node Lifecycle Activity. Check the name of the blocker by moving the mouse on the bar.

definition.title: Count of nodes being cordon by `draino`  per cluster
Drain failure cause evolution over 1 week
Drain failure cause evolution over 1 day
Drain failure cause evolution over selected timerange

definition.content:
Permanent failures represents node for which automatic retry has failed more that 7 times.
The system then give up.
The node is uncordon and it is annotated with:
`draino/drain-retry-failed: failed`

[link to list of nodes](https://app.datadoghq.com/orchestration/overview/node?query=annotation%23draino%2Fdrain-retry-failed%3Afailed&paused=false)

To purge the NLA history on that node and restart a complete cycle from the beginning change the value of the annotation:
`draino/drain-retry-failed: restart`
[link to nodes](https://app.datadoghq.com/orchestration/overview/node?query=annotation%23node-lifecycle.datadoghq.com%2Fprovision-new-node-before-drain%3Atrue&paused=false)

definition.content: Nodes are **counted multiple times** if they have multiple conditions, and multiple or all conditions are selected. The typical use case for this section is to select the special tag `condition:any` or a single condition, e.g., `condition:cluster-upgrade`.

queries.query: sum:draino.filters_node_filters{$datacenter AND $kube_cluster_name AND $ng_namespace AND $ng_name AND (filter:labels OR filter:pods)} by {nodegroup_namespace,nodegroup_name,group_key,kube_cluster_name}
